PRAGMA foreign_keys=OFF;
BEGIN TRANSACTION;
CREATE TABLE test ( a int );
CREATE TABLE "auth_permission" (
    "id" integer NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
    "name" varchar(50) NOT NULL,
    "content_type_id" integer NOT NULL,
    "codename" varchar(100) NOT NULL,
    UNIQUE ("content_type_id", "codename")
);

CREATE TABLE "auth_group" (
    "id" integer NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
    "name" varchar(80) NOT NULL UNIQUE
);
CREATE TABLE "auth_user" (
    "id" integer NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
    "username" varchar(30) NOT NULL UNIQUE,
    "first_name" varchar(30) NOT NULL,
    "last_name" varchar(30) NOT NULL,
    "email" varchar(75) NOT NULL,
    "password" varchar(128) NOT NULL,
    "is_staff" bool NOT NULL,
    "is_active" bool NOT NULL,
    "is_superuser" bool NOT NULL,
    "last_login" datetime NOT NULL,
    "date_joined" datetime NOT NULL
);
INSERT INTO "auth_user" VALUES(1,'nick','','','nick@loman.net','sha1$73e1b$4fcdc2b6d10026fca6878c9c38af0ecdade17381',1,1,1,'2012-02-07 17:44:12.562026','2009-10-01 13:14:25.419000');

CREATE TABLE "auth_message" (
    "id" integer NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
    "user_id" integer NOT NULL REFERENCES "auth_user" ("id"),
    "message" text NOT NULL
);
CREATE TABLE "django_content_type" (
    "id" integer NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
    "name" varchar(100) NOT NULL,
    "app_label" varchar(100) NOT NULL,
    "model" varchar(100) NOT NULL,
    UNIQUE ("app_label", "model")
);

CREATE TABLE "django_session" (
    "session_key" varchar(40) NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
    "session_data" text NOT NULL,
    "expire_date" datetime NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE "django_site" (
    "id" integer NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
    "domain" varchar(100) NOT NULL,
    "name" varchar(50) NOT NULL
);
INSERT INTO "django_site" VALUES(1,'example.com','example.com');
CREATE TABLE "auth_group_permissions" (
    "id" integer NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
    "group_id" integer NOT NULL REFERENCES "auth_group" ("id"),
    "permission_id" integer NOT NULL REFERENCES "auth_permission" ("id"),
    UNIQUE ("group_id", "permission_id")
);
CREATE TABLE "auth_user_groups" (
    "id" integer NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
    "user_id" integer NOT NULL REFERENCES "auth_user" ("id"),
    "group_id" integer NOT NULL REFERENCES "auth_group" ("id"),
    UNIQUE ("user_id", "group_id")
);
CREATE TABLE "auth_user_user_permissions" (
    "id" integer NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
    "user_id" integer NOT NULL REFERENCES "auth_user" ("id"),
    "permission_id" integer NOT NULL REFERENCES "auth_permission" ("id"),
    UNIQUE ("user_id", "permission_id")
);
CREATE TABLE "django_admin_log" (
    "id" integer NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
    "action_time" datetime NOT NULL,
    "user_id" integer NOT NULL REFERENCES "auth_user" ("id"),
    "content_type_id" integer REFERENCES "django_content_type" ("id"),
    "object_id" text,
    "object_repr" varchar(200) NOT NULL,
    "action_flag" smallint unsigned NOT NULL,
    "change_message" text NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE "platform" (
    "id" integer NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
    "short_name" text NOT NULL,
    "long_name" text NOT NULL,
    "slug" text NOT NULL,
    "manufacturer_website" text NOT NULL
);
INSERT INTO "platform" VALUES(1,'Roche/454','Roche 454','roche-454','http://www.454.com/');
INSERT INTO "platform" VALUES(2,'Illumina GA2','Illumina Genome Analyser 2x','illumina-ga2','http://www.illumina.com/');
INSERT INTO "platform" VALUES(3,'SOLiD','ABI SOLiD','abi-solid','http://www.abi.com/');
INSERT INTO "platform" VALUES(5,'Polonator','Polonator','polonator','http://www.polonator.org/');
INSERT INTO "platform" VALUES(9,'Illumina HiSeq','Illumina HiSeq 2000','HiSeq','Illumina');
INSERT INTO "platform" VALUES(10,'PacBio','Pacific Biosciences','pacific-biosciences','http://www.pacificbiosciences.com/');
INSERT INTO "platform" VALUES(11,'Ion Torrent','Ion Torrent','ion-torrent','http://www.iontorrent.com/');
INSERT INTO "platform" VALUES(12,'Illumina MiSeq','Illumina MiSeq','illumina-miseq','http://www.illumina.com/');
CREATE TABLE "centre_capacity" (
    "id" integer NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
    "centre_id" integer NOT NULL REFERENCES "centre" ("id"),
    "platform_id" integer NOT NULL REFERENCES "platform" ("id"),
    "number_machines" integer
);

CREATE TABLE "centre" (
    "id" integer NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
    "name" text NOT NULL,
    "slug" text NOT NULL,
    "url" text NOT NULL,
    "notes" text NOT NULL,
    "lat" real NOT NULL,
    "long" real NOT NULL,
    "service_facility" bool,
    "dedicated_genome_centre" bool,
    "contact_name" text,
    "contact_email" text,
    "contact_mask" text
, "locality" text NOT NULL default '', "country_id" integer NULL REFERENCES "centres_country" ("id"), "continent_id" integer NULL REFERENCES "centres_continent" ("id"), capacity_summary text, "date_created" datetime);

b) On-Array capture using Agilent''s SureSelect technology.

Sequence the regions that matter...  DNA Capture methods are simple and cost effective, highly robust alternatives to tedious and expensive multiple PCRs for enriching targeted genomic regions prior to Next Generation Sequencing (NGS).  Such capture methods complement massively parallel NGS technologies and enable researchers to sequence and analyze variations in specific genomic regions in a focused manner across large number of samples in a very short period of time.

CREATE TABLE "centres_country" (
    "id" integer NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
    "name" text NOT NULL,
    "x1" real,
    "x2" real,
    "y1" real,
    "y2" real,
    "country_code" text NOT NULL
, "continent_id" integer NULL REFERENCES "centres_continent" ("id"), sw_lat real, sw_long real, ne_lat real, ne_long real);

CREATE TABLE "centres_continent" (
    "id" integer NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
    "name" text NOT NULL,
    "x1" real,
    "x2" real,
    "y1" real,
    "y2" real
, sw_lat real, sw_long real, ne_lat real, ne_long real);

INSERT INTO "centres_continent" VALUES(33,'Antarctica',NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL,NULL);
CREATE TABLE "centres_pendingcentreupdates" (
    "id" integer NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
    "date_created" datetime NOT NULL,
    "ip_address" varchar(16) NOT NULL,
    "email_address" varchar(200) NOT NULL,
    "modification_type" varchar(10) NOT NULL
);
CREATE TABLE "centres_pendingcentrecapacity" (
    "id" integer NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
    "platform_id" integer NOT NULL REFERENCES "platform" ("id"),
    "number_machines" integer,
    "centre_id" integer NOT NULL REFERENCES "centres_pendingcentreupdates" ("id")
);

CREATE TABLE "centres_pendingcentreupdate" (
    "id" integer NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
    "name" varchar(100) NOT NULL,
    "slug" varchar(100) NOT NULL,
    "url" varchar(255) NOT NULL,
    "notes" text NOT NULL,
    "lat" real NOT NULL,
    "long" real NOT NULL,
    "service_facility" bool,
    "dedicated_genome_centre" bool,
    "contact_name" varchar(100),
    "contact_email" varchar(100),
    "contact_mask" varchar(100),
    "locality" varchar(100) NOT NULL,
    "country_id" integer REFERENCES "centres_country" ("id"),
    "date_created" datetime NOT NULL,
    "ip_address" varchar(16) NOT NULL,
    "email_address" varchar(200) NOT NULL,
    "update_to_id" integer REFERENCES "centre" ("id"),
    "processed" bool NOT NULL
, capacity_summary text, akismet_spam boolean null);

INSERT INTO "centres_pendingcentreupdate" VALUES(297,'Centre for Genomic Regulation','centre-for-genomic-regulation','http://www.crg.es/','The sequencing field has experienced a major shift with the introduction of innovative, high-throughput sequencing technologies developed by 454/Roche and Solexa/Illumina.  The Unit is presently equipped with one Illumina Genome Analyzer II (GA II) sequencer, and one Roche 454 FLX sequencing instrument. Service is provided to the CRG, PRBB, and external users. The Illumina and 454 platforms complement each other very well. While Illumina sequencing generates millions of short reads per run (presently 36-50 nt reads), 454 reads (Titanium chemistry) exceed 400 nt, though data sets are smaller. Thus, Solexa is the ideal platform for projects that require large numbers of short reads e.g. ChIP-Seq and miRNA detection experiments, while 454 is more suitable for projects that benefit from the information that longer reads provide, e.g. de novo sequencing and transcriptome characterization in the absence of a reference genome.  The services currently offered reflect the needs of a heterogeneous group of researchers and include ChIP-Seq, RIP-Seq, digital gene expression profiling, miRNA discovery and expression analysis, amplicon sequencing, re-sequencing and de novo sequencing.  Starting with DNA or RNA samples provided by users, the services offered include sample processing (e.g. attachment of adapters), prior to sequencing on the GA II and the 454–FLX instruments, and performing the sequencing runs. Raw image data are processed and sequence data are made available to the users (sequence files, quality files, alignment files).  Requests and questions should be directed to Heinz Himmelbauer.',41.376809,2.197266,NULL,NULL,'heinz.himmelbauer','heinz.himmelbauer@crg.es','','Barcelona',8,'2010-03-18 09:17:43.067485','193.62.198.197','n.j.loman@bham.ac.uk',29,1,'GA2,454',NULL);

INSERT INTO "centres_pendingcentreupdate" VALUES(384,'Centre for Genomic Regulation','centre-for-genomic-regulation','http://www.crg.es/','The sequencing field has experienced a major shift with the introduction of innovative, high-throughput sequencing technologies developed by 454/Roche and Solexa/Illumina.  The Unit is presently equipped with one Illumina Genome Analyzer II (GA II) sequencer, and one Roche 454 FLX sequencing instrument. Service is provided to the CRG, PRBB, and external users. The Illumina and 454 platforms complement each other very well. While Illumina sequencing generates millions of short reads per run (presently 36-50 nt reads), 454 reads (Titanium chemistry) exceed 400 nt, though data sets are smaller. Thus, Solexa is the ideal platform for projects that require large numbers of short reads e.g. ChIP-Seq and miRNA detection experiments, while 454 is more suitable for projects that benefit from the information that longer reads provide, e.g. de novo sequencing and transcriptome characterization in the absence of a reference genome.  The services currently offered reflect the needs of a heterogeneous group of researchers and include ChIP-Seq, RIP-Seq, digital gene expression profiling, miRNA discovery and expression analysis, amplicon sequencing, re-sequencing and de novo sequencing.  Starting with DNA or RNA samples provided by users, the services offered include sample processing (e.g. attachment of adapters), prior to sequencing on the GA II and the 454–FLX instruments, and performing the sequencing runs. Raw image data are processed and sequence data are made available to the users (sequence files, quality files, alignment files).  Requests and questions should be directed to Heinz Himmelbauer.',41.3851807442909,2.19426155090332,NULL,NULL,'heinz.himmelbauer','heinz.himmelbauer@crg.es','','Barcelona',8,'2010-03-23 05:40:46.458351','193.145.46.52','n.j.loman@bham.ac.uk',29,1,' 2 x GA2, 1 x 454',NULL);

Helixxa is a biotechnology company based on genomics and focused primarily on the provision of services in molecular analysis performed in next-generation platforms. Our technical and operational infrastructure gives our customers the most comprehensive services, running on a large scale. To ensure maximum satisfaction of our customers, we offer a specialized technical consultancy to the design of optimal assays, and the processing and analysis of bioinformatics.
We are the first private company in Latin America in this segment of services to offer a full range of tests, from investigation of SNPs to sequencing of whole genomes. We also offer technical and scientific support for the development of projects aimed at generating intellectual property and discovery of new molecular markers in partnership with our customers. In addiltion, we develop projects for various economic sectors and government entities.

5. Whole genome sequencing services (Bacteria to human genome - simply send us the gDNA and get back annotated genome sequence)

6. Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) services (Targeted Re-sequencing, SNP, Mutation identification, Whole Genome Sequencing, Transcriptome sequencing, ChIP sequencing, Methylome sequencing, Small RNA sequencing)

a) Re-sequencing and de-novo sequencing using Next generation sequencing technologies- We are very pleased to announce successful completion of bacterial re-sequencing project at Genotypic

Next generation sequencing technologies allows quick and economical sequencing of small genomes and transcriptomes for identification of mutations, polymorphisms and other variations (insertions, deletions, copy number variations and rearrangements) between the organisms.

b) On-Array capture using Agilent''s SureSelect technology.

Sequence the regions that matter...  DNA Capture methods are simple and cost effective, highly robust alternatives to tedious and expensive multiple PCRs for enriching targeted genomic regions prior to Next Generation Sequencing (NGS).  Such capture methods complement massively parallel NGS technologies and enable researchers to sequence and analyze variations in specific genomic regions in a focused manner across large number of samples in a very short period of time.

7. Comprehensive NGS data analysis services (Any platform, Any application, Any format - Publication quality reports) Software for genomics data analysis and interpretation (GeneSpring GX V 11.0 – Gold standard software for interactive desktop computing environment that promotes investigation and enables understanding of microarray data within a biological context., Biointerpreter - User-friendly web-based Biological interpretation tool for microarray data, Medruner - Mine medline at will for genes / functions or any keywords, Pubmine - Mine gene-disease, gene-gene associations, NGS QC Tool - Quick and instant QC of raw Next Generation sequence reads, SADA - Sequence Aided diagnostics application)

We are pleased to inform that Genotypic has developed a custom microarray using Agilent 1 million probes array to capture and sequence human / mouse / rat exome (all exons in the genome).  Microarray On-Array capture technology in combination with next generation sequencing platforms allow assessment of genetic variations within the exome of any individual.

6. Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) services (Targeted Re-sequencing, SNP, Mutation identification, Whole Genome Sequencing, Transcriptome sequencing, ChIP sequencing, Methylome sequencing, Small RNA sequencing)

a) Re-sequencing and de-novo sequencing using Next generation sequencing technologies- We are very pleased to announce successful completion of bacterial re-sequencing project at Genotypic

Next generation sequencing technologies allows quick and economical sequencing of small genomes and transcriptomes for identification of mutations, polymorphisms and other variations (insertions, deletions, copy number variations and rearrangements) between the organisms.

b) On-Array capture using Agilent''s SureSelect technology.

Sequence the regions that matter...  DNA Capture methods are simple and cost effective, highly robust alternatives to tedious and expensive multiple PCRs for enriching targeted genomic regions prior to Next Generation Sequencing (NGS).  Such capture methods complement massively parallel NGS technologies and enable researchers to sequence and analyze variations in specific genomic regions in a focused manner across large number of samples in a very short period of time.

7. We are pleased to inform that Genotypic has developed a custom microarray using Agilent 1 million probes array to capture and sequence human / mouse / rat exome (all exons in the genome).  Microarray On-Array capture technology in combination with next generation sequencing platforms allow assessment of genetic variations within the exome of any individual.

Sequence the regions that matter...  DNA Capture methods are simple and cost effective, highly robust alternatives to tedious and expensive multiple PCRs for enriching targeted genomic regions prior to Next Generation Sequencing (NGS).  Such capture methods complement massively parallel NGS technologies and enable researchers to sequence and analyze variations in specific genomic regions in a focused manner across large number of samples in a very short period of time.

CREATE TABLE "serial_serialnumber" (
    "id" integer NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
    "serial_number" varchar(40) NOT NULL,
    "platform_id" integer NOT NULL REFERENCES "platform" ("id"),
    "installation_date" varchar(40) NOT NULL,
    "location" varchar(60) NOT NULL,
    "approved" bool NOT NULL,
    "ip_address" char(15) NOT NULL,
    "added_on" datetime NOT NULL
);

CREATE INDEX "auth_permission_content_type_id" ON "auth_permission" ("content_type_id");
CREATE INDEX "auth_message_user_id" ON "auth_message" ("user_id");
CREATE INDEX "django_admin_log_user_id" ON "django_admin_log" ("user_id");
CREATE INDEX "django_admin_log_content_type_id" ON "django_admin_log" ("content_type_id");
CREATE INDEX "centre_capacity_centre_id" ON "centre_capacity" ("centre_id");
CREATE INDEX "centre_capacity_platform_id" ON "centre_capacity" ("platform_id");
CREATE INDEX "centres_pendingcentrecapacity_platform_id" ON "centres_pendingcentrecapacity" ("platform_id");
CREATE INDEX "centres_pendingcentrecapacity_centre_id" ON "centres_pendingcentrecapacity" ("centre_id");
